channel.title: CI Whonix Testing
channel.description:
Currently, I have a repo working for automated whonix integration testing. This is a continuation of the WATS senior capstone project, and will be integrated in to the new CI stuff I built.
https://github.com/Mycobee/whonix_automated_test_suite
I am creating a new thread to log my efforts and progress, so as to keep things readable and up to date.
@Patrick you had a list of desired test cases somewhere right? Can't seem to find it at the moment.

item.title: CI Whonix Testing
item.dc:creator: bee
item.description:
this one is disco and ready to go @Patrick

github.com/Whonix/derivative-maker

Update CI readme to include XFCE configuration

Whonix:master ← Mycobee:update-ci-readme
opened 01:57AM - 01 Nov 22 UTC
Mycobee
+14 -11

Update CI to build VMs with GUI and `automated_builder` README to include XFCE c…onfiguration details

It builds VMs now with the GUI setting and launches the VM

Next step I will have tag pushes automatically run WATS. This PR sets the stage for that to happen

Read full topic

item.title: CI Whonix Testing
item.dc:creator: bee
item.description:
then all forks can have CI turned off in settings, and Whonix/derivative-maker ensures no more than 1 build at a time is ever running

Read full topic

item.title: CI Whonix Testing
item.dc:creator: bee
item.description:
Patrick:

Not sure what would be to do on my side.

Add me as a collaborator on Whonix/derivative-maker but set up rules where I can’t push to master, can open pull requests, and can’t merge my own pull requests

Then all CI builds can be commited directly to Whonix/derivative-maker but not the master branch.

Important to not give me access to master though, and set up rules that PR must be merged by an admin (you).

Read full topic

item.title: CI Whonix Testing
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Thanks for the head up! No worries.

bee:

The easiest solutiion might be giving me access to CI builds on whonix repo, but not sure offhand how to set that up.

Not sure what would be to do on my side.

Read full topic

item.title: CI Whonix Testing
item.dc:creator: bee
item.description:
Doing some testing today, might cause collisions of CI builds if you are doing the same @Patrick…just a heads up in case unexpected failures occur

(should probably figure out a way to fix this but how do you add more hours in a day?)

The easiest solutiion might be giving me access to CI builds on whonix repo, but not sure offhand how to set that up. It is set up to not do more than 1 build at a time per repo, but when mycobee repo and whonix repo are doing CI it collides

Read full topic

item.title: CI Whonix Testing
item.dc:creator: bee
item.description:
VPS has XFCE on it now with tightvnc configured for inspection. Working on building non-headless Whonix VMs in CI.

Next step is to run wats, which I have already done locally so it shouldnt be too bad. There is a PR that is open @Patrick , but it is not ready to merge yet (still iterating)

I will let you know once it is

Read full topic

item.title: CI Whonix Testing
item.dc:creator: bee
item.description:
Awesome. Also just fyi your build failed today because I was testing some things. Apologies. Should probably figure out how to let multiple CI builds run in parallel, but not a priority at the moment

Read full topic

item.title: CI Whonix Testing
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
resolved - update issue - fasttrack: 500 SSL error: wrong version number / unexpected TLS packet News
This has been resolved by Debian.

Read full topic

item.title: CI Whonix Testing
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Not CI specific. Created

update issue - fasttrack: 500 SSL error: wrong version number Support
issue: Err:4 http://HTTPS///fasttrack.debian.net/debian bullseye-fasttrack InRelease 500 SSL error: wrong version number [IP: 127.0.0.1 3142] solution soon here: https://www.kicksecure.com/wiki/Operating_System_Software_and_Updates#fasttrack_500_SSL_error:_wrong_version_number

for it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: bee
item.description:
@Patrick can you look at this failed build? I am working on getting everything set up for GUI testing, and am having failing CI when I push a tag. Strange it seems it passed a couple days ago for you.

It says something about a bad SSL version when trying to grab a package

github.com

Uncomment for full build

Build VMs #114

item.title: CI Whonix Testing
item.dc:creator: bee
item.description:
Currently, I have a repo working for automated whonix integration testing. This is a continuation of the WATS senior capstone project, and will be integrated in to the new CI stuff I built.

GitHub

GitHub - Mycobee/whonix_automated_test_suite: An automated testing suite...

An automated testing suite using RSpec and Shell Scripting for the privacy focused Whonix distribution - GitHub - Mycobee/whonix_automated_test_suite: An automated testing suite using RSpec and She...

I am creating a new thread to log my efforts and progress, so as to keep things readable and up to date.

@Patrick you had a list of desired test cases somewhere right? Can’t seem to find it at the moment.

Read full topic
